document.docAuthor: Lu, Xiuxia, Legalov, Anderi A. & Zhang, Runzhi
document.masterDocTitle: A New Subgenus And Two New Species Of Magdalis Germar From Northern China (Coleoptera: Curculionidae: Magdalinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A New Subgenus And Two New Species Of Magdalis Germar From Northern China (Coleoptera: Curculionidae: Magdalinae)

heading.emphasis:
Key to Subgenera of
Magdalis
of the World

paragraph.keyLead:
2. Tarsi with single falciform claw - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
Dagmalis Kôno and Morimoto, 1960
3. Rostrum short and straight, in male not longer than head - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 4

5. Scutellum at same level as elytra, almost completely filling space between elytra and base of pronotum. Elytral intervals covered with deep coarse wrinkles, impunctate. Femora without or with small teeth - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 6

5 9 Scutellum strongly depressed or moderately declined anteriorly, not filling space between elytra and base of pronotum. Elytral intervals punctured. Femora with large teeth. If elytra covered with coarse transverse wrinkles or femoral tooth small, then antennal club as long as funicle - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 7

6. Antennal club oval, in both sexes shorter than funicle. Sides of pronotum strongly arcuate, strongly constricted anteriorly. Elytral intervals covered with very sparse but quite distinct hairs. Claws with teeth - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
Panopsis Daniel, 1903

6 9 Antennal club of male markedly elongate, longer than funicle, densely covered with erect hairs. Sides of pronotum more weakly arcuate laterally and weakly constricted anteriorly. Elytral intervals inconspicuously pubescent. Claws simple or with teeth - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
Panus Schönherr, 1823
7. Lateral margin of pronotum with carina, spine or projection - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 8
7 9 Lateral margin of pronotum without carina, spine or projection - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 9

8. Lateral margin of pronotum in apical part with carina, spine or projection. Femora and claws with teeth (in
M. fallax Kirsch
with simple claws) - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
Odontomagdalis Barrios 1984

8 9 Lateral margin of pronotum near middle with carina, spine or projection. Femora with teeth, claws without teeth - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
Amblyodontomagdalis
Lu and Legalov ,
new subgenus

9. All femora with teeth, that of front femur large and pointed; if teeth relatively small, then color brownish red. Claws simple. Antennal club in both sexes shorter than funicle. Rostrum longer than head capsule. Body bare dorsally. Elytra not completely covering pygidium, intervals in most species very finely rugose, distinctly punctured, often with metallic or greenish blue shining, rarely brownish red - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
Magdalis
s. str , 1817

Magdalis
.

bibRefCitation.refString: Barrios, H. E. 1984. A review of weevils of the genus Magdalis Germ. (Coleoptera, Curculionidae) of the fauna of Mongolia. Nasekomye-Mongolii 9: 366 - 403.

paragraph.keyLead: 9 9 Femora without or with inconspicuous teeth; claws usually each with a basal tooth. Antennal club in male as long as funicle. Rostrum in male nearly as long as head capsule. Elytra completely covering pygidium, intervals densely coarsely
